StartTime.description:
Start time of the schedule.
The format should be ISO 8601
i.e. yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. E.g. 2022-02-15T06:55:00Z.

NeverEnd.description:
When set to true, it creates a schedule that never ends.
**Note**: The NeverEnd is true by default. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise, it remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description:
The number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed.
• For Example: If you provide empty 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndTime.description:
End time after which the schedule should stop. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.
• For Example: If you provide empty an end date-time, the schedule will end when the end date-time is reached.
• E.g. 2022-02-15T06:55:00Z.

ScheduleType.description:
Schedule frequency.
• Values allowed Weekly only.

RecurrenceWeeks.description: Enter the Recurrence week By default 1.

RecurrenceDays.description:
Enter the day from the list.
(Values allowed are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday).
For Example: Monday.

RefreshSettings.description:
Refer to the JSON syntax below to configure Refresh settings.

 **Note**: Refresh settings is only applicable for the web extract type data source. It will not work for live connection mode data sources.

PermissionEntity.description:
Specifies an entity of item for permission.

Available permission entities are:

`"AllCategories"` `"AllDashboards"` `"AllDataSources"` `"AllSchedules"` `"AllSlideshow"` `"DashboardsInCategory"` `"SpecificCategory"`

`"SpecificDashboard"` `"SpecificDataSource"` `"SpecificSchedule"` `"SpecificSlideshow"` `"AllGroups"` `"AllPermissions"` `"AllSettings"`

`"SpecificGroup"` `"SpecificPermissions"` `"SpecificSettings"` `"UsersandGroups"`

PermissionAccess.description:
Specifies an access type for item.

Permission access values available for the permission entities:

1. `"AllCategories"` `"AllDataSources"` `"AllSchedules"` `"AllSlideshow"` has `"Create"` `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"`

2. `"AllDashboards"` `"DashboardsInCategory"` has `"Create"` `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"` `"Download"`

3. `"SpecificCategory"` `"SpecificDataSource"` `"SpecificSchedule"` `"SpecificSlideshow"` has `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"`

4. `"SpecificDashboard"` has `"Read"` `"ReadWrite"` `"ReadWriteDelete"` `"Download"`

5. `"AllGroups"` has `"Create"`

6. `"AllPermissions"` `"AllSettings"` `"SpecificGroup"` `"SpecificPermissions"` `"SpecificSettings"` `"UsersandGroups"` has `"Manage"`

UserId.description: Specifies the User ID to whom the permission has been added.

GroupId.description: Specifies the Group ID if this permission is inherited from the group where the user is associated; otherwise, its value will be 0.

InheritedFromGroup.description: Specifies the values as true if it is group permission where the user is associated; otherwise, the value will be false.

ItemName.description:
Specifies the Item name with respective to its permission entity.

Item name available for permission entities:

1. `"SpecificSettings"` has `"Dashboard Settings"` `"Embed Settings"` `"Integrations"` `"Look and Feel"` `"Notification Settings"` `"Security"`

`"Site Settings"` `"User Directory Settings"` `"Authentication Settings"` `"CORS Settings"` `"SiteCredentials"` `"Accounts Settings"` `"Connectors"` `"Data Process"`


2. `"SpecificPermissions"` has `"Category"` `"Dashboard"` `"Datasource"` `"Schedule"` `"Slideshow"`

3. `"DashboardsInCategory"` `"SpecificCategory"` has the Name of `"Category"`

`"SpecificDashboard"` has the Name of `"Dashboard"`

`"SpecificSchedule"` has the Name of `"Schedule"`

`"SpecificDataSource"` has the Name of `"Datasource"`

`"SpecificSlideshow"` has the Name of `"Slideshow"`

4. `"SpecificGroup"` has Group Name.

ApiScheduleRequest.description: Details about the schedule that was passed will be added.

ExportType.description: Specifies the export type to schedule the dashboard. Valid values: `Excel` `Image` `Pdf`.

StartTime.description: Specifies the UTC start date-time of schedule. The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

NeverEnd.description:
When set to true, it creates a schedule with no end.

 **Note**: By default, the NeverEnd is set to true. To set the end time for the schedule, fill the properties of either EndAfterOccurrence or EndDate; otherwise remains empty.

EndAfterOccurrence.description:
Specifies the number of occurrences after which the schedule will be completed. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will end after the completion of 5 occurrences.

EndDate.description:
Specifies the UTC end date-time of schedule, after which schedule will be completed.

The format should be ISO 8601 i.e. `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`. For example: If you provide an end date-time, the schedule will end when the end date-time is reached.

UserList.description: Provides a list of email addresses or user IDs to the recipients who will get the schedules.

GroupList.description: Provides a list of group IDs to the recipients in the group list who will get the schedules.

ExternalRecipientsList.description: Provides a list of email addresses to the email recipients who will get the schedules.

ScheduleType.description:
Specifies the schedule type to schedule the dashboard. Valid values: `Hourly` `Daily` `Weekly` `Monthly` `Yearly`. 

 **Note**: If you choose the schedule type as `Monthly`, provide a value to the `MonthlySchedule` property, and leave the (HourlySchedule, DailySchedule, WeeklySchedule and YearlySchedule) properties empty.

IsEnabled.description: Returns true, if the schedule is enabled.

FailureNotificationToOwner.description: Returns true, if the failure notification to an owner is enabled.

FailureNotificationToRecipient.description: Returns true, if the failure notification to the recipient is enabled.

HourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

DailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

WeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

MonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

YearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

Size.description:
PDF page size.
Values allowed are A3, A4, A5, Letter

Orientation.description:
PDF page orientation.
Values allowed are Landscape, Portrait

Extension.description:
Excel or Image extension.
Values allowed for Excel file are xlsx, xls

Values allowed for Image file are jpg, png
Extension.default: xlsx for Excel and jpg for image

FtpURL.description: Use the FTP URL to save the exported file.
Use the FTP URL to save the exported file.

ApiHourlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on an hourly basis.

ScheduleInterval.description:
Specifies the hour interval. Based on this interval, the schedule will run continuously until the end time.

The format should be `HH:mm`.

ApiDailySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a daily basis.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs every day or every working day.

Valid values: `EveryNdays` `EveryWeekday`. **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as EveryNdays, provide a value to the `EveryNdays` property, and leave the (EveryWeekday) property empty.

EveryNdays.description:
Specifies the day interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 2, the schedule recurs every 2 days.

EveryWeekday.description: For the schedule to recur every working day, set to true.

ApiWeeklySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a weekly basis.

RecurrenceWeeks.description:
Specifies the week interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 2, the schedule will recur every 2 weeks.

RecurrenceDays.description:
Specifies the list of days the schedule recurs.

Valid values `Sunday` `Monday` `Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide `Sunday`, the schedule will recur sunday's of every 2 weeks.

ApiMonthlySchedule.description: Runs the schedule on a monthly basis.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a day basis or on the customized day basis.

Valid values: `DayRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence` **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as DayRecurrence, provide a value to the `DayRecurrence` property and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

DayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

ApiMonthlyScheduleDayRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the day specified on the month interval.

DayInterval.description:
Specifies the number of day interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 10, the schedule will recur every 10th day.

MonthInterval.description:
Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 3, the schedule will recur 10th day of every 3 months.

ApiMonthlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the customized day of the specified month interval.

WeekOfMonth.description:
Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description:
Specifies the day of the week the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday`

`Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on the second week of sunday.

MonthInterval.description:
Specifies the number of month interval the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur second week of sunday's of every 5 months.

ApiYearlySchedule.description: Runs the schedules on a yearly basis.

YearInterval.description:
Specifies the number of years the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 5, the schedule will recur every 5 years.

RecurrenceType.description:
Specifies the recurrence type, whether the schedule recurs on a month basis or on the customized month basis.

Valid values: `MonthRecurrence` `CustomRecurrence`. **Note**: If you choose the recurrence type as `MonthRecurrence`, provide a value to the MonthRecurrence property, and leave the (CustomRecurrence) property empty.

MonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in `YearInterval` property.

CustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the `YearInterval` property.

ApiYearlyScheduleMonthRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs on the month and number of years specified in `YearInterval` property.

MonthOfYear.description:
Specifies the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June`

`July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. For example: If you provide April, the schedule will recur in April of every year. Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.

DayOfMonth.description:
Specifies the day of the month the schedule recurs. 

 For example: If you provide 20, the schedule will recur 20th April of every year.  Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.

ApiYearlyScheduleCustomRecurrence.description: The schedule recurs in the customized month based on the number of years provided in the `YearInterval` property.

WeekOfMonth.description:
Specifies the week of the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `first` `second` `third` `fourth` `last`. For example: If you provide second, the schedule will recur on the second week.

DayOfWeek.description:
Specifies the day of week the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `day` `weekday` `weekendday` `Sunday` `Monday`

`Tuesday` `Wednesday` `Thursday` `Friday` `Saturday`. For example: If you provide Sunday, the schedule will recur on every sunday's of the second week.

MonthOfYear.description:
Specifies the month the schedule recurs.

Valid values: `January` `February` `March` `April` `May` `June`

`July` `August` `September` `October` `November` `December`. For example: If you provide March, the schedule will recur on the sunday's of the second week of March every year. Here, the (year) is the value provided in the `YearInterval` property.
